info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 09 at 9:26PM CDT until June 09 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR CARSON...GRAY AND SOUTHWESTERN ROBERTS COUNTIES... At 925 PM CDT, automated weather equipment reported a 77 mph wind gust 2 miles east of Pampa. Severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles north of Lefors to 10 miles south of Kingsmill to 5 miles west of Groom, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Panhandle, White Deer, Groom, Lefors, Skellytown, Lake Mcclellan and Kingsmill. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
